title: Using skrmdb
text: methods Spearman-Karber, Reed-Muench, Dragstedt-Behrens commonly used estimate ED50. follows, use following variable notation: x vector corresponding log dilution dose group. n integer vector corresponding group size log dilution dose. y integer vector corresponding number responding log dilution dose. examples SpearKarb(), however, usage DragBehr() ReedMuench() identical.

title: Using skrmdb
text: main functions skrmdb can called three different ways. illustrate , start simple data set number dead increases dosage. First use historical, deprecated, function call. preferred method use formulas function call. can use formula individual vectors. can also use formula columns data.frame.
code: dead <- c(0, 3, 5, 8, 10, 10) total <- rep(10, 6) dil <- 1:6 SpearKarb(y = dead, n = total, x = dil) ## Warning: skrmdb :: Calling this function with the parameters y, n, x is ## depreciated. ## ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method ## ed:   2.9 ## Count trend is increasing with dilution. SpearKarb(dead + total ~ dil) ## ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method ## ed:   2.9 ## Count trend is increasing with dilution. data <- data.frame(y = dead, n = total, x = dil) SpearKarb(y + n ~ x, data) ## ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method ## ed:   2.9 ## Count trend is increasing with dilution.

title: Using skrmdb
text: methods designed work assumption x either increasing decreasing y / n increasing index. decided functions DragBehr(), ReedMuench(), SpearKarb() sort data according assumption. illustrate , create data descending according dilution. see mater enter data, ED50 reported. However, can decided turn autosort, give us different, incorrect, estimate ED50.
code: dead <- c(10, 10, 8, 5, 3, 0) total <- rep(10, 6) dil <- 1:6 SpearKarb(dead + total ~ dil) ## ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method ## ed:   4.1 ## Count trend is decreasing with dilution. SpearKarb(rev(dead) + rev(total) ~ rev(dil)) ## ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method ## ed:   4.1 ## Count trend is decreasing with dilution. SpearKarb(dead + total ~ dil, autosort = FALSE) ## ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method ## ed:   2.9 ## Count trend is decreasing with dilution.

title: Using skrmdb
text: function skrmdb.returns ED50 three methods, along additional data data sets may interest. section, use example data set titration. data.frame contains results hypothetical experiment ED50 three vials (numbered 1, 2, 3) tested three anonymous operators (TK, NU, CT). First need compute log dilution. Plotting data shows us tests visually seem give roughly ED50, unfortunately, missing data points.  find ED50 aggregation data 9 tests three methods. can also see difference Operators; Vial; Operator Vial.
code: head(titration) ##   testID   PrepID PrepRole      Date Vial Operator   dil positive total ## 1   BRSV BRSV-001     test 03-Mar-19    1       TK 1e-02       10    10 ## 2   BRSV BRSV-001     test 03-Mar-19    1       TK 1e-03       10    10 ## 3   BRSV BRSV-001     test 03-Mar-19    1       TK 1e-04        9    10 ## 4   BRSV BRSV-001     test 03-Mar-19    1       TK 1e-05        6    10 ## 5   BRSV BRSV-001     test 03-Mar-19    1       TK 1e-06        1    10 ## 6   BRSV BRSV-001     test 03-Mar-19    1       TK 1e-07        1    10 titration$log_dil <- -log10(titration$dil) ggplot(titration, aes(x = log_dil, y = positive)) +   geom_point() +   facet_grid(Vial ~ Operator) +   geom_line() skrmdb.all(positive + total ~ log_dil, titration) ##   DragBehr ReedMuench SpearKarb SpearKarb.var response.increasing ## 1 5.365201   5.331023  5.332341   0.005014876               FALSE ##   duplicate.dilutions even.dilution monotonic bracket.midpoint ## 1                TRUE          TRUE      TRUE             TRUE skrmdb.all(positive + total ~ log_dil | Operator, titration) ##   Operator DragBehr ReedMuench SpearKarb SpearKarb.var response.increasing ## 1       TK 5.286004   5.247059  5.283333    0.01954578               FALSE ## 2       NU 5.376350   5.340000  5.333333    0.01222222               FALSE ## 3       CT 5.418526   5.402062  5.383333    0.01399022               FALSE ##   duplicate.dilutions even.dilution monotonic bracket.midpoint ## 1                TRUE          TRUE     FALSE             TRUE ## 2                TRUE          TRUE     FALSE             TRUE ## 3                TRUE          TRUE     FALSE             TRUE skrmdb.all(positive + total ~ log_dil | Vial, titration) ##   Vial DragBehr ReedMuench SpearKarb SpearKarb.var response.increasing ## 1    1 5.405272   5.377551  5.383333    0.02231347               FALSE ## 2    2 5.339806   5.304348  5.300000    0.01164751               FALSE ## 3    3 5.360000   5.319149  5.333333    0.01454527               FALSE ##   duplicate.dilutions even.dilution monotonic bracket.midpoint ## 1                TRUE          TRUE      TRUE             TRUE ## 2                TRUE          TRUE      TRUE             TRUE ## 3                TRUE          TRUE      TRUE             TRUE skrmdb.all(positive + total ~ log_dil | Vial + Operator, titration) ##   Vial Operator DragBehr ReedMuench SpearKarb SpearKarb.var response.increasing ## 1    1       TK 5.306306   5.266667      5.30    0.06666667               FALSE ## 2    1       NU 5.429825   5.411765      5.40    0.04777778               FALSE ## 3    1       CT       NA         NA      5.20    0.02777778               FALSE ## 4    2       TK 5.185185   5.153846      5.20    0.04555556               FALSE ## 5    2       NU 5.285714   5.235294      5.20    0.02333333               FALSE ## 6    2       CT 5.500000   5.500000      5.50    0.03555556               FALSE ## 7    3       TK 5.482759   5.400000      5.55    0.08250000               FALSE ## 8    3       NU 5.411765   5.375000      5.40    0.04333333               FALSE ## title: Class definition for skrmdb object — skrmdb-class
text: eval Evaluation method. One "ReedMuench", "SpearKarb", "DragBehr". character string. ed Median effective dose eval method. numeric. var Variance (Spearman-Kärber method ). numeric. data data used compute effective median dose. data.frame, numeric. message Messages warnings generated durning calculation. character string.

what: Function to run all three methods for determining ED50. — skrmdb.all
title: Function to run all three methods for determining ED50. — skrmdb.all
text: function used primarily CVB statistics section run three methods included skrmdb package determining ED50.

title: Function to run all three methods for determining ED50. — skrmdb.all
Function to run all three methods for determining ED50. — skrmdb.all
text: formula formula form y + n ~ x y + n ~ x | v1 + ... + vK. y number responding dilution level, n number tested dilution level, x dilution levels.  v1, ..., vK grouping variables.  y, n, x, v1, ..., vK must distinct. data data.frame containing titration data. Formatted specified CVB Data Guide. autosort Default TRUE.  TRUE sort data according either sort(x) sort(-x) y / n appears increasing index.  three methods assume data ordered.

title: Function to run all three methods for determining ED50. — skrmdb.all
text: data.frame containing columns subset variables, ED50 computed DragBehr, ReedMuench, ED50 variance computed SpearKarb, columns logical values indicate data increasing decreasing log_dil, even dilution scheme, monotonic, brackets midpoint.

title: skrmdb package — DragBehr
text: skrmdb package provides functionality compute median effective dose (ED50) using Dragstedt-Behrens, Reed-Muench, Spearman-Kärber estimators.

title: skrmdb package — DragBehr
code: DragBehr(formula, data, y, n, x, autosort = TRUE, warn.me = TRUE, show = FALSE)  ReedMuench(   formula,   data,   y,   n,   x,   autosort = TRUE,   warn.me = TRUE,   show = FALSE )  SpearKarb(   formula,   data,   y,   n,   x,   autosort = TRUE,   warn.me = TRUE,   show = FALSE )

title: skrmdb package — DragBehr
text: formula formula form y + n ~ x cbind(y, n) ~ x data data frame y integer vector corresponding number responding log dilution dose. n integer vector corresponding group size log dilution dose. x vector corresponding log dilution dose group. autosort Default TRUE.  TRUE sort data according either sort(x) sort(-x) y / n appears increasing index.  three methods assume data ordered. warn.TRUE, warnings messages related processing data displayed. show TRUE, print intermediary statistics used calculate ED50.

title: skrmdb package — DragBehr
text: object class skrmdb

title: skrmdb package — DragBehr
text: Dragstedt-Behrens Reed-Muench methods estimate median effective dose interpolating two doses bracket dose producing median response. accumulate sums directions assuming responded lower dose respond higher dose, respond higher dose respond lower dose. Dragstedt-Behrens method estimates ED50 interpolating line connects hypothetical fractions bracketing doses ED50, Reed-Muench method estimates ED50 intersection lines connecting two sets cumulative sums bracketing doses. Spearman-Karber method gives non-parametric estimate mean tolerance distribution empirical distribution (EDF). empirical PMF derived EDF differencing estimator \(\sum{ x f(x)}\). EDF cover entire support x, SpearKarb() extends assuming next lower dilution produce zero response next higher dilution produce complete response.

title: skrmdb package — DragBehr
text: methods assume y monotonic x, however ED50 still computed case. methods also assume data brackets ED50.  data bracket ED50, result still returned, accuracy value estimating ED50 suspect. Many microbiology texts mistakenly present Dragstedt-Behrens method Reed-Muench method.

title: skrmdb package — DragBehr
text: Behrens, B. (1929) Zur Auswertung der Digitalisblätter im Froschversuch. Arkiv für Experimentelle Pathologie und Pharmakologie. 140: 237-256. Dragstedt, C. ., Lang, V. F. (1928). Respiratory Stimulants Acute Cocaine Poisoning Rabbits. J. Pharmacology Experimental Therapeutics. 32: 215–222. Kärber, G. (1931). Beitrag zur kollektiven Behandlung Parmakogischer Reihenversuche. Archiv für Experimentelle Pathologie und Pharmakologie. 162: 480–483. Miller, Rupert G. (1973). Nonparametric Estimators Mean Tolerance Bioassay. Biometrika. 60: 535 - 542. Reed LJ, Muench H (1938). Simple Method Estimating Fifty Percent Endpoints. American Journal Hygiene. 27: 493–497. Spearman, C. (1908). Method "Right Wrong Cases" ("Constant Stimuli") without Gauss's Formulae. Brit. J. Psychology. 2: 227–242.

title: skrmdb package — DragBehr
text: Maintainer: CVB Statistics CVB.Data.Help@usda.gov [former owner] Authors: David Siev (2019) Marie Vendettuoli (2019) Thomas Kent (starting 2020)

title: skrmdb package — DragBehr
code: # All examples are with `SpearKarb`, however, the usage for # `DragBehr` and `ReedMuench` is identical.  ## Monotonically increasing data # The three calls are equivalent. dead <- c(0, 3, 5, 8, 10, 10) total <- rep(10, 6) dil <- 1:6 data <- data.frame(y = dead, n = total, x = dil) SpearKarb(dead + total ~ dil) #> ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method #> ed:   2.9  #> Count trend is increasing with dilution. SpearKarb(y + n ~ x, data) #> ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method #> ed:   2.9  #> Count trend is increasing with dilution. SpearKarb(y = dead, n = total, x = dil)  # depreciated #> Warning: skrmdb :: Calling this function with the parameters y, n, x is depreciated. #> ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method #> ed:   2.9  #> Count trend is increasing with dilution.  ## Decreasing data # The function will reverse the order of the data # and two calls are equivalent. dead <- c(10, 10, 8, 5, 3, 0) total <- rep(10, 6) dil <- 1:6 SpearKarb(dead + total ~ dil) #> ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method #> ed:   4.1  #> Count trend is decreasing with dilution. SpearKarb(rev(dead) + rev(total) ~ rev(dil)) #> ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method #> ed:   4.1  #> Count trend is decreasing with dilution.  ## Unordered data # Observe that the data is not monotonic after being sorted by dil. dead <- c(10, 8, 5, 3, 0) total <- rep(10, 5) dil <- c(1, 3, 2, 4, 5) SpearKarb(dead + total ~ dil) #> skrmdb :: y is not monotonic. ED50 may be unreliable. #> ED50 by the Spearman-Karber method #> ed:   3.1  #> Count trend is decreasing with dilution. #> y is not monotonic. ED50 may be unreliable.

title: Example titration data. — titration
text: dataset illustrates dichotomous data format titration data found CVB DATA Guide.  data purposely incomplete - monotonic.

title: Example titration data. — titration
Example titration data. — titration
text: data.frame 67 rows 9 columns testID: Mandatory. test identifier unique table. Every test must test identifier. PrepID: Mandatory. identifier preparation used. usually lot serial number vaccine. PrepRole: Mandatory. role preparation. must reference, test, . Date: Optional. Date test performed. Vial: Optional. vial number tested. Operator: Optional. operator performed test. dil: Mandatory. dilution used well. positive: Mandatory. Total number positive readings (tubes wells) affected challenge. total: Mandatory. total number tubes wells group (treatment group specified dilution).

title: Version 4.4
text: Total rewrite functions. enforce adata sorted. Gives warnings Expanded function definitions used set going Warnings possible problems data. use y, n, x parameters deprecated.

title: Version 4.2.4
text: SpearKarb, ReedMuench, DragBehr enforce input data sorted x (either increasing decreasing). estimate calculated. SpearKarb, ReedMuench, DragBehr evaluate input data y variable monotone display results warning. estimate calculated original order regardless direction. Y variables monotone, SpearKarb, ReedMuench, DragBehr evaluate whether input monotone increasing monotone decreasing display results message. estimate calculated original order regardless direction. examples unordered X variable, X variable direction, Y variable direction, Y variable monotone added SpearKarb, ReedMuench, DragBehr help pages
